result.execSummary:
The defendant Ted S. Tuttle Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Same huber privileges as stated in 14CF163.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 14CF163.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ted S. Tuttle Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ted S. Tuttle in court with attorney Leon Stanley Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 14CF163 and 14CF286.

1:33 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Schmidt states no corrections need to be made on PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.

Defendant makes statement on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
14CF163:
Count 1-
Sentence withheld
Probation for 36 months
Serve 360 days in the county jail
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department. 180 days confinement with 180 days on home monitor. 
1 day jail credit 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
36 month DL revocation;  Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation - effective today's date
36 month IID on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in his name to commence as of today's date
Pay fine of $600 + costs
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
Pay $26.45 for blood draw
Submit to DNA test if not already submitted
Pay DNA surcharge  

Count 2 - DRI

14CF286:
Count 1 - 
County jail for 360 days to run concurrent to 14CF163  (11/26/14-Amended to correct the jail term from 360 days to 180 days)
Same huber priveleges as stated in 14CF163
Pay costs

Count 2 - DRI

Atty Schmidt provides exemption form for IID on vehicle not owned.
Court requests a new order be provided as a signature had been put in the wrong spot.
Order to be provided to the Judge for signature.
Sentencing hearing on October 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ted S. Tuttle in court with attorney Leon S. Schmidt. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-163 and 14CF-286.

10:35 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

14CF-286 needs an initial appearance done on this case. A Preliminary waiver form is filed in this case

14CF-163: Defendant will plead to this charge. BAC charge would be dismissed 
14CF-286 Count 1 Defendant will plead to. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in

 In the OWI case, State recommends a 6 yrs prison sentence, stayed, requests probation for 36 months, 360 days jail, fine of approx $4,000 with costs, $26.45 blood draw, 36 mo rev, 36 mo iid, dot assessment, aoda and comply, empt, other counseling

In the OAR case, State recommends 360 day jail sentence concurrent and pay costs.

Atty Knaapen is anticipating a PSI.
Atty Schmidt concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

14CF-286:
Initial Appearance:
Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the complaint, waives reading.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing wavier is filed.
State files information and Court accepts it for filing.
Atty Schmidt has received a copy of the information and waives reading.
Court informs Defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant pleads GUILTY to Count 1

14CF-163:
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Atty Schmidt.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF-286: Count 1: OAR 343.44(1)(b)
14CF-286: Count 2: Dismissed and Read in
14CF-163: Count 1: OWI 5th 346.63(1)(a)
14CF-163: Count 2: Dismissed

Court will order a PSI.
Bond is ordered continued.
Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Comply with all other bond conditions that are previously set in other matters.    Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Ted S. Tuttle in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Law Intern Taylor Kraus also appears.
9:32 a.m. case is called.
Address is verified.
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Has an attorney already.  Leon Schmidt is retained for other file (OWI).
Court advises must have attorney file a Notice of Retainer.
Intern advises 14CF163

**Defendant would like to consult with an attorney

ADA Cousins makes a statement that Attorney Schmidt is aware of this matter.
Court is hesitant to give up his rights as long as his attorney is not present (waive time limits)
9:37 a.m. case is concluded.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
